title: Identify Basic Notes
task: Play individual white notes by the letter from the keyboard
tip: White keys are the basic notes and they keep repeating through the keyboard. The notes are C, D, E, F, G, A, B. The C note is the white key immediately to the left of each group of two black keys.

title: Identify Notes
task: Play individual notes by the letter from the keyboard
tip: The black keys are called sharps or flats. Each black key is the sharp of the white key before it and the flat of the white key after it. For example the first black key after C is called C# (C-sharp) and Db (D-flat).

title: Identify Notes on the Stave
task: Look at the note on the stave and play the correct note.
tip: In the treble clef, the notes on the lines from bottom to top are E, G, B, D, F (Evil Guys Bring Danger Fun). The spaces spell FACE.

title: Learn C Major
task: Play the C Major Scale in ascending order
tip: The major scales follow a step pattern starting from the root key Whole Whole Half Whole Whole Whole Half

title: Learn D Major
task: Play the D Major Scale in ascending order
tip: The major scales follow a step pattern starting from the root key Whole Whole Half Whole Whole Whole Half
